subject: Ethics
title: Aristotle on Character
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Aristotle on Character.

hook.text: A brave act doesn't make you brave. You're brave when courage becomes second nature.

buildup.text: Aristotle shifted the question from 'what should I do?' to 'what kind of person should I be?'

discovery.text: Virtues are character traits built by repeated practice, like muscles built at the gym.

twist.text: You can't just know the right thingâ€”you have to become the kind of person who does it naturally.

climax.text: For Aristotle, ethics isn't about following rules. It's about forming a good character over time.

punchline.text: You don't do good things. You become a good person.

quiz.question: How did Aristotle say virtues are developed?
options: By repeated practice until they become habits of character
